decks.notes: The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of low-cost aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, backed up by burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage. The deck also utilizes card draw and card selection tools like Academic Dispute and Stormchaser's Talent to maintain momentum and keep up the pressure. The deck aims to quickly establish board presence and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures quickly to apply pressure on the opponent. It utilizes efficient mana dorks like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves to ramp into powerful threats like Archon of Emeria and Skyclave Apparition. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben disrupts opponent's spells while Collected Company allows for explosive creature plays. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast creatures and disruptive elements, utilizing the synergies between different creatures to create a strong board presence and win the game quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix and utilize cheap spells like Lightning Axe and Fiery Impulse to control the board while maintaining card advantage with Treasure Cruise and Consider. Utilizing Opt, Sleight of Hand, and Artist's Talent allows for consistency in drawing through the deck and finding key pieces. The inclusion of Picklock Prankster adds pressure on the opponent and the deck has a mix of damage-based removal and counterplay options to handle different threats.

The deck focuses on using low-cost aggressive creatures and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It includes cards that synergize well together, such as Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, as well as spells like Reckless Rage and Torch the Tower to remove opposing threats. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to both red and blue mana sources. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and win the game before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on using early game disruption with cards like Thoughtseize, Duress, and Fatal Push to control the opponent's resources and tempo. It then transitions into a mid-to-late game strategy by deploying powerful threats like Sentinel of the Nameless City and Ouroboroid, backed up by removal spells like Maelstrom Pulse and Abrupt Decay to maintain board control. The deck also includes some mana acceleration with Llanowar Elves and Mutavault to help ramp into its bigger threats. Overall, the deck aims to systematically dismantle the opponent's game plan while establishing its own dominance on the battlefield.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through a combination of counter spells and bounce effects. It aims to slow down the opponent's game plan by returning their spells to their hand and disrupting their board state. By utilizing a variety of card draw options and efficient removal spells, the deck aims to out value the opponent and maintain control of the game. The inclusion of powerful finishers like Gran-Gran and Combustion Technique helps close out the game once the opponent has been sufficiently controlled.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to maintain a fast-paced and aggressive playstyle through a combination of low-cost creatures and direct damage spells. The deck focuses on dealing damage quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to establish their own game plan. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Soul-Scar Mage, and Reckless Rage, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and force the opponent onto the defensive. Boomerang Basics and Divide by Zero provide disruption, while Stormchaser's Talent and Emberheart Challenger offer additional damage potential.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with low-cost, efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, backed up by burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage. The deck also includes card draw and tempo manipulation cards like Academic Dispute and Boomerang Basics to maintain pressure and disrupt opponents. With a mix of creatures, burn spells, and utility cards, this deck aims to maintain aggressive momentum while controlling the board and closing out games swiftly.

This Esper Aggro deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Nashi, Raffine, and Cecil to apply pressure on the opponent. It also utilizes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the board. The deck includes a mix of legendary lands and powerful planeswalkers like Jace Reawakened to provide additional value and versatility. With a mix of creature aggression, disruption, and card advantage, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly while also having the tools to deal with various threats.

The deck focuses on fast-paced aggression and utilizing cheap spells to control the board and deal direct damage to the opponent. With cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage to quickly apply pressure, along with spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to remove threats, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly. Academic Dispute provides card draw and Boomerang Basics can disrupt the opponent's tempo. The deck's strength lies in its ability to quickly build a threatening board presence and efficiently close out games.

The main focus of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like Archon of Emeria, Skyclave Apparition, and Badgermole Cub. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Aven Interrupter and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. Collected Company provides additional opportunities to put creatures on the battlefield, while Elspeth, Storm Slayer offers a powerful finisher. Utilizing mana accelerants like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats while maintaining pressure on the board.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly and aggressively attack the opponent with low-cost creatures and burn spells. The deck focuses on dealing direct damage to the opponent while controlling the board with removal spells. The key is to maintain a fast pace and pressure the opponent early on to prevent them from establishing a strong defense. The deck also utilizes instant/sorcery spells to buff creatures and deal additional damage to the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes some land control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and low-cost spells to deal damage quickly. It focuses on utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Soul-Scar Mage, and Stormchaser's Talent to maximize damage output, supported by spells like Reckless Rage and Monstrous Rage to control the board. The mana base is designed for efficient casting of both red and blue spells, giving the deck flexibility in dealing with different threats. Overall, the deck aims to be proactive and apply pressure from the beginning of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board through removal spells and hand disruption while also utilizing creatures with strong abilities to dominate the battlefield. By utilizing cards like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize and Vanishing Verse, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain control of the game. Additionally, cards like Preacher of the Schism and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse provide powerful threats that can help secure victory. The deck also includes lands that can provide additional utility and mana fixing to support its game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of disruption and removal spells to control the opponent's board while gradually building up its own resources. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, while also efficiently removing threats with Fatal Push and Maelstrom Pulse. The deck also includes creatures like Badgermole Cub and Ouroboroid for additional pressure and resilience. Overall, the deck seeks to outlast the opponent through attrition and carefully managing resources to ultimately take control of the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and hand through a combination of removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse, as well as hand disruption like Thoughtseize and Duress. It also utilizes powerful creatures like Blade of the Oni and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to pressure the opponent and maintain board presence. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure smooth casting of both black and white spells. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent through efficient removal and proactive threats.
